suncertify.presentation.gui
Class BookingConfigurationPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  suncertify.presentation.gui.BookingConfigurationPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class BookingConfigurationPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This class extends JPanel and is a sheared panel used to configure the application depending on which mode it has been started. It takes an ApplicationMode Enum and uses it to determine the layout and functionality of the various components in this panel. Once the layout and functionality has been initialized, it is used to set the startup parameters for the application appropriate to the mode in a properties file (suncertify.properties) located in the root directory. If the suncertify.properties does not exist, one will be created.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Black
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

BookingConfigurationPanel

public BookingConfigurationPanel(ApplicationMode mode,
                                 java.awt.Container dialog)
This constructor is used when the application is started in either stand alone or network client mode. It takes an ApplicationMode Emun used to initialize, create functionality and layout appropriate to the application mode used and a Container to so it can be references later e.g. to close the dialog. After initializing the mode and dialog fields, it calls the init() method to build and initialize the panel components.

Parameters:
mode - the ApplicationMode Emun.
dialog - the Container containing this panel.

BookingConfigurationPanel

public BookingConfigurationPanel(ApplicationMode mode)
This constructor is used when the application is started in server mode. It takes an ApplicationMode Emun used to initialize, create functionality and layout appropriate to the application mode used. After initializing the mode field, it calls the init() method to build and initialize the panel components.

Parameters:
mode - the ApplicationMode Emun.
